pullRequest.title: chore: add back dummy mapValues at table source for SR-enabled joins
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
Follow-up to #6715. The previous PR removed the forced materialization at table sources for sources used in joins with SR-integrated key formats, as it's known that these sources will be repartitioned prior to the join. As part of doing so, the previous PR also removed the dummy mapValues() call at such table sources, as it's a no-op. This PR adds back the no-op mapValues() in order to have consistent topologies with other table queries, so that in the future we can remove table source materializations for queries that don't require them in a more general way, without changing existing topologies or needing a special-case for table joins with repartitions (see #6750 for more).
Testing done
QTT.
Reviewer checklist

 Ensure docs are updated if necessary. (eg. if a user visible feature is being added or changed).
 Ensure relevant issues are linked (description should include text like "Fixes #")

commit.message: chore: add back dummy mapValues at table source for SR-enabled joins

nodes.bodyText: I'm not sure why Github is rendering this file as having been deleted. A new version is added back in the third commit in this PR (see 58da19f#diff-8f6edbed395aac8e9c455d95a9bee5855dcb0d8230b2b280d50093def7198380) but GitHub isn't displaying the new file for some reason?
